intro: Brachyactis menthodora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mint. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant features aromatic leaves with a strong menthol scent, which is characteristic of the Lamiaceae family. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with square stems and opposite leaves. Brachyactis menthodora is often cultivated for its medicinal properties and use in traditional herbal remedies.
